author: {'steamid': '76561197977657096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1627314455}
review:
Stimmiges Adventure, toll präsentierte Szenerie (trotz schwarzer Balken, die auf meinem weiten Monitor die eigentlich vorhandene Grafik abdecken, bis sie es noch weiter zum Rand hin nicht mehr tun und hier und da versteckte Figuren zeigen). Aber egal, die Atmosphäre stimmt, die Charaktere funktionieren und die Rätsel sind vorhanden, aber nicht zu anstrengend gekünstelt. Und nein, ich finde sechs Stunden sind nicht zu kurz für ein Adventure, man braucht sowas nicht ewig in die Länge ziehen, das machts nur zäh.

Ich mag wie die kleine Knutschkugel eingesetzt werden kann, da gibts immer wieder überraschende Momente und sogar das Kind nervt nicht. Toll vertont ist das Ganze auch noch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190933825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1627226833}
review: Grundsätzlich kann ich mich über das Spiel nicht beschweren. Es ist optisch super, die Figuren sind liebevoll entworfen und man kann sie gern haben, Spot ist dabei, es gibt auch ein paar lustige Stellen. Doch wer den ersten Teil (Whispered World) kennt, wird hier wohl enttäuscht sein. Es ist ziemlich schnell klar, wie die Geschichte endet, die Rätsel sind im Gegensatz zum ersten Teil eher einfach und leicht zu durchschauen und das Spiel ist auch ziemlich kurz. Ich würde sagen, lieber den ersten Teil nochmal spielen, als die Fortsetzung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043366093', 'num_games_owned': 953, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1627078619}
review:
Слушайте, давайте честно: игра хорошая - и история, и персонажи, и графика... Короткая, разве что, но тут лучше меньше, чем филлер сплошной делать.
...Но вот управление у игры чудовищное. Я играл с геймпада, и без отключения его из порта мышку не цепляет. Пройти с геймпада момент с луми ближе к концу 3го акта - нереально. Далее, скорость загрузки локаций - оно с ссд как у миссий в старкрафте 2 - т.е. по полминуты. В квесте? вы серьезно?
...и все бы ничего, но авторы не сумели поправить эти косяки за 4,5 года с момента покупки.
В общем, после отмены Девилз Мэн дедаиков я больше не поддерживаю.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032705777', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1624273707}
review:
This is an upsetting squeal to The Whispered World.   I was hoping to play a game with the same quality as the first with story with some nice updated graphics.  The story was .... ok.  The characters that is where the problems are they are just completely unrealistic.  For example a character gets mad at you viciously points a knife at you and angrily says I'm not a murderer.  The main heroes are kind of pathetic but not in the funny way Sadwik was from the original.  There is no inventory system so most of what you have to do is too easy to figure out.  The animation of characters was jerky and had a hard time expressing motions with out hand movements.  Like those underbudget need to produce a show every week CGI cartoons that used to air on tv.

If your looking for a chill stream that doesn't stick to one game check me out at https://www.twitch.tv/justthepassenger !

author: {'steamid': '76561198023965543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 269, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1625437189}
review:
[h1]SHRNUTÍ[/h1]
   Tuto povedenou adventuru jednoznačně doporučuji. Přímočaré dobrodružství na 6 hodin v prvotřídním 3D grafickém kabátku navozující dojem kreslených prostředí. Hra přímo navazuje na první díl [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/268540/The_Whispered_World_Special_Edition/]The Whispered World[/url].
+ super animace
+ kresleně vypadající 3D prostředí
+ pěkná hudba
+ automatický inventář
+ přímočaré na 6 hodin
+ některé hlavolamy lze přeskočit
+ Spot má opět několik forem
+ super kvalita anglického dabingu
+ možnost upravit velikost titulků
+ možnost upravit zobrazení tipů
- dlouhé načítání scén (z SSD 10 až 20 sekund)
- není humorné jako první díl

[h1]DĚJ[/h1]
   Nad malým městečkem se rozezněly sirény. Noah hledá svou malou sestřičku Renie, která s kamarádkami staví sněhuláka. „Renie! Musíme se dostat do bunkru!“, říká neodbytně Noah. Bombardéry už jsou na obloze a dvojice před nimi prchá do bezpečí bunkru. Noah přibouchne dveře a otáčením kola dveře zajišťuje. Na průzor dveří dopadá ručka v palčácích. Zřejmě jde o Ranienu kamarádku. Je ale pozdě i přes tak malý a uzoučký průzor se bunkr prozáří mohutnými výbuchy. Jsou v bezpečí,… ale na jak dlouho.

[h1]INSTALACE[/h1]
   Do základní hry lze doinstalovat [url=https://prekladyher.eu/preklady/silence.1001/]české titulky[/url] s úplnou diakritikou.
[b]Češtinu je nutné zapnout v menu hry (Options / Language).[/b]

[h1]JAK SE HRAJE[/h1]
   Hra "SILENCIE" je akčněji pojatou adventurou, která přímo navazuje na první díl [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/268540/The_Whispered_World_Special_Edition/]The Whispered World[/url].
Narozdíl od prvního dílu tato hra není moc humorná a je zde úplně jiný systém OVLÁDÁNÍ. Ovládá se pouze klikáním a pohybem myši. Když tam není aktivní prvek, hrdina tam dojde. Když tam je aktivní prvek, změní se kurzor na dostupnou akci znázorněnou krátkou animací kurzoru (ruka = sebrat/použít; žebřík = vylézt, atp.). Není tu ani klasický INVENTÁŘ. Kombinování v inventáři tedy neexistuje, a pokud lze něco použít ve scéně, tak se změní kurzor na danou věc a aktivní prvek má obrys té věci. Některé aktivní prvky jsou POHYBLIVÉ. Tam se tlačítko podrží a pohybem myši v možném směru se akce provede (např. posunutí). Prostřední tlačítko zobrazí aktivní prvky a případně i slovní nápovědu, co je třeba udělat (nehrozí zásek). Jak jsem zmínil hra je AKČNĚJŠÍ, takže se tu setkáte i s balancováním, časově omezeným řešením a možným selháním a tedy opakováním řešení.
   Hru si lze PŘIZPŮSOBIT. Můžete si upravit velikost titulků a povolit zobrazení celého titulku naráz, což doporučuji, protože standardně se postupně vypisuje, což je velice nepraktické. Dále si můžete upravit, zda se při použití předmětu z inventáře zobrazí obrys předmětu na aktivním prvku (bez obrysu se po najetí kurzoru kurzor rozanimuje na znamení možné akce), zda se po stisku kolečka zobrazí textová nápověda, zda se zvýrazní aktivní prvky blízko kurzoru (při stisku kolečka se i tak všechny zvýrazní) a zda se po najetí na aktivní prvek zobrazí jeho jméno/popis.
   Kromě dvou hlavních hrdinů (Renie a Noaha) tu opět hrajete i za HOUSENKU Spota. Ten opět muže měnit svou formu. Tentokrát má ale jen tři základní stavy, které se mění podržením tlačítka a pohybem myši nahoru (míč) či dolů (placka). Mezipoloha je klasická housenka. Kromě těchto trvale přístupných forem se v závislosti na okolnostech setkáte ještě s dalšími. Jelikož hrajete za TŘI POSTAVY, tak se stává, že dělají něco paralelně. V jednom čase můžete tedy řešit až tři různé scény, mezi kterými se občas dá přepínat a které na sebe mohou vzájemně působit. To ale vyplývá ze situace, takže rozdělení hrdinů není volbou hráče. Klasické DIALOGY s výběrem možností tu v podstatě nejsou. Celá hra je pojata filmověji a hráč má občas možnost vybrat ze dvou reakcí. Podvědomě ale tuším, že je asi jedno co si vybere. Ukládání je také automatické a hra umožňuje uchovávat postup až tří hráčů. Na konci si hráč vybere jeden ze DVOU KONCŮ. Po dohrání a načtení pozice si může zkusit zvolit druhý konec.

review:
Wish i could play it but seems it does not like my system or it has some major bugs. and being an older game i highly doubt it will be fixed so essentially a waste of money.

What i have seen of it looks and sounds like a game i would enjoy, but alas it crashes about ten min ( i know it states 0.9 hours playtime, but this is literally me retrying the same section over and over) into the game, at the exact same spot each time. you place an egg in a nest, egg hatches then boom, screen freezes, puts my GFX card into a weird state whereby i have to restart. Having spent a considerable amount of time searching for an answer to my problem, new save, reinstall etc. nothing helps. In summery i can not recommend i can not play. 

If by some miracle i find a solution and i am able to play, i will revise this. 

1 out of 5

author: {'steamid': '76561198302208299', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 5330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5330, 'last_played': 1623318427}
review:
This Point & Click Adventure game set in the world of Silence is a sequel to Daedalic’s 2009 game [i]The Whispered World[/i]. Though there are some references to its predecessor, this game is entirely playable without ever having heard of the previous one. Those who loved [i]The Whispered World[/i] will find references to it throughout the game, including some returning characters. Despite taking place in the same world, [i]Silence[/i] has a very different feel and aesthetic.

One of the things that I really enjoyed from [i]The Whispered World[/i] was the graphics. The game was made using more traditional 2D animation in a style reminiscent of a 1990s cartoon. It was very well animated and though some content was a bit depressing, the animation style lightened the mood. For [i]Silence[/i], they decided to use 3D animation. I don’t have anything against 3D animation, however, the aesthetic is quite different. The sprites in general have decent rigging and walkpaths, but I found the textures to be an odd mix of smooth yet still angular. The design, overall, wasn’t bad, but was more what I expect in a console game as opposed to a PC game. As a fan of the first game, I would have preferred if more of it's aesthetics were carried over into this sequel.

In [i]Silence[/i], Noah and his sister Renie start off running to a bomb shelter in what seems reminiscent of a World War II plane bombing. Though they make it safely to the shelter, neither is particularly excited to have to stay there for an extended time. In order to comfort Rennie, Noah retells her the story of his time as Sadwick the clown in the world of Silence.  After another bomb drops, caving in the shelter, Noah has to look around for Rennie.  He follows her voice only to find himself, once again, in Silence.  Noah must now embark on a journey find and save his sister.  Throughout the game you switch between controlling Noah, Rennie, or Spot.

The story and writing weren't terrible, but it was more than a little predictable. Some of the writing seemed a little off. For example the main character, Renie, just wasn’t written well to actually sound like a child her age would. Sometimes, her dialogue sounds like a much older than her age and others like a much younger. While I personally found that a little annoying, it didn’t make the game or story entirely unenjoyable. There are quite a few places in the game where you are given two different dialogue options.  This gives the illusion of choice, but doesn't generally have an impact on the overall story arc. At best, you may hear a slight difference in dialogue or see a slightly different animation.  The only choice that really makes a difference is at the end of the game, pick between two endings. Neither ending seems to be a “true” ending, and personally, I didn’t find either of them satisfying.

My biggest issues with this game were its interface and mechanics. While [i]The Whispered World[/i] was designed exclusively for PC, [i]Silence[/i] was developed for both PC and console systems. This led to a lot of interface and mechanic choices that favor consoles and make for a very different feel in gameplay compared to most Point & Click Adventure games. When I play Point & Clicks, I generally expect to have an inventory that I can interact with, and [i]Silence[/i] doesn’t have one. You may pick something up, but you cannot view your inventory or randomly combine an item. If you can use something, it will show up as you mouse over the object/character. You also can’t utilize a traditional save game system. Instead, the game autosaves at checkpoints. Unfortunately, it doesn’t tell you where exactly those checkpoints are. This can lead to losing a fair amount of progress. These interface issues seem largely tied to making it more playable for consoles, but can somewhat alienate PC Point & Click fans like myself.

The other issue I have with the mechanics is mostly win regard to the annoying balance checks and push/pull objectives they put in the game. There are several places where your character will need to balance on something by moving the cursor to counterbalance. There are also several times when you must grab onto something and drag the cursor to push or pull something. These seem optimized for a console controller.  I played this game on a laptop, and these parts we’re extremely difficult to accomplish on a laptop’s trackpad. My trackpad simply doesn’t have enough distance (at 6 inches/15 cm wide) to cover in order to complete a pull/push or balance well. Many players in the forums recommend playing with an Xbox controller.  Being that I don't have that type of controller, I ended up attaching an external mouse instead. I felt, even with the mouse, the controls for these parts were unusually difficult.   It still required dragging my mouse in the extreme from one end of my mouse pad to the other end (and sometimes past the end of my mouse pad) in order to complete the action.  Using a mouse, however, was still easier than the laptop trackpad for these tasks.. 

Some of the good things about the interface and mechanics are that, like many Daedalic games, there is an option to highlight hotspots. This can really help you out if you are struggling to figure out what to do next. You can also fast click to the next screen as well as through some of the dialogues. Unfortunately, if you are playing multiple playthroughs the many unskippable dialogues will feel even longer to go through.  An option to skip through all dialogues would have made it much more enjoyable for replays.

For a Point & Click Adventure game, puzzles were lacking. It didn’t have very many puzzles (or mini-games) and the ones it did have, were too easy. They simply didn’t feel satisfying to complete.  If you don’t like puzzles and mini-games, this may be a positive aspect for you.  If you struggle with a mini-game, there is an option to skip it.

Achievement hunters will both love and hate this game. On the one hand, [i]Silence[/i] has 46 achievements, giving you plenty to go after. Most Point & Clicks average only 20-30 in a game. It also boasts a nice mix of different types of achievements including ones that are story unlocked, collections, sequence based, repeated action based, and unusual action-dependent based achievements. On the other hand, you cannot get all the achievements in only one playthrough, several achievements are buggy, and there’s several either-or achievements. If you utilize the checkpoint save feature and a walkthrough/guide, you could probably get all the achievements in two playthroughs. However, you’ll have to complete two whole playthroughs at the minimum, to get them all.  I ended up having to play through many times to reach 100%, and it quickly became tedious.  The good news is that many of the achievements which require multiple things are cumulative over all your playthroughs.

Your first playthrough is likely to take about 9-10 hours. Subsequent playthroughs may be slightly shorter, but not a whole lot due to unskippable cutscenes and dialogue. At full price, that makes this game around $2/hr of playtime if you play through once. It’s a reasonable price for how much time you get out of it, as long as you enjoy playing the game. This is, unfortunately, one of the games I wish Steam had a “meh” rating for.  I don’t know if I’d really recommend it much except for those who really loved [i]The Whispered World[/i] and want to revisit it in a new adventure. I would warn them though that it's also likely to be a bit of a disappointment.

review:
Una aventura point & click muy bonita. Con escenarios agradables y diseños memorables. Es una historia corta pero que logra tocar la fibra del espectador sobre todo con las decisiones finales. Una historia hermosa y triste con una camino divertido. La duración esta bien para este tipo de juego y el precio no es muy alto. 

Aparentemente esta es una secuela, no jugué el primer juego pero no descarto hacerlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984662640', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1622734499}
review:
If you are a fan of adventure games this one is worth playing; Make sure you play 'A Whispered World' first as this is a sequel.
The 'wiggle the mouse cursor' mechanics are annoying at first, especially if you have a high dpi mouse (I almost run out of screen on multiple occasions) but you soon get used to it.
It has a tragic storyline with two possible endings. Like most Daedalic games there are many achievements if you are bothered about such things.

review: much shorter than the whispered world (ie. the first in this series), very light on puzzling, would class it as more of an adventure than a traditional 'combine various items' point & click .... so so pretty to look at ... our caterpillar companion spot is even more adorable than in the first game - so cute! i loved this ... and perhaps there will be a third in this series (we hope)?? recommended for lovers of cuteness, sweetness, and oh so pretty graphics .... nicely done yet again Daedalic!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198838466985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1621676896}
review:
算是我玩这个类型的第一款游戏，我还以为这类型点击解密类都会这么单调冗长，所以这款游戏只玩了一半，同类型的也连续几年没有玩过，直到最近重新玩起其他同类型，才发现这款《沉寂》是真的冗长，
1.人物的动机很迷让人玩的时候不知道自己在干什么，因果不清晰，不知道怎么样是对的，为什么这样是对的
2.试错成本很大，重复性的内容太多太长，试着点一下花一秒，等待失败动作过去要花费十秒，很难有耐心
3.章节混乱，节奏太慢，不知道前面还有多久
4.光标提示混乱，太过花哨的光标不如只有一两种提示和一个固定的使用方式
5.CPU温度太高，电脑运行仿佛下一秒就要爆炸
6.闪退不频繁但是确实出现过

author: {'steamid': '76561197992694498', 'num_games_owned': 2769, 'num_reviews': 450, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1537268319}
review:
[h1]One of the better Deadalic p&c games[/h1]

Silence is a traditional point&click game from Deadalic studios. I always was a fan of the genre but I never got to love Daedalic point&click games and i'm so glad they started making games leaning towards narrative/story driven ones like Pillars of the Earth and State of Mind. I don't know why but there's something in their point&click games that I can't enjoy them. But Silence is one of the better ones.

You travel to a another world where weird creatures live. You meet some companions, friends and foes and try to save the world. The gameplay is pretty standard but I for some reason don't like it. I never liked Daedalic puzzle approach and the whole exploration aspect. I can't even fully explain why. I loved the story of Edna and Harvey but I can't find words how much I hated the gameplay. This is better but still feels a bit similar. Puzzles just are not fun because actions take too much time maybe, the pacing seems weird too. Puzzles in this game are better than lets say Memoria (which I hated, I found them boring and too difficult which distracted me from the story). Fortunately this game has a really good emotional story which kept me going.
But we can clearly see this game probably was the first one which started leaning towards story driven games more. The story is heartbreaking and I suggest you to play it just for the story, especially the ending.

Visual character and world design are great too. Characters look really good and they are adorable. Areas you explore are beautiful although the one at the ending was way too annoying. Other than that this game visually is outstanding.

Music is pretty good and at times it was great but voice acting is ok...ish at best. While some characters sound good, others don't sound well. But i'm used to "ok" voice-acting since i play a lot of lower budget games and it's understandable.

A decent point&click game with emotional story for the fans of the genre.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Great story
[*]Good characters
[*]Beautiful world
[/list]
[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]Pacing if off
[*]Puzzles are no fun
[*]Ending si annoying (gameplay-wise)
[/list]

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32930811-Kosmos%27s-Cosmic-reviews/?appid=704030][h1]Follow my curator page for more[/h1][/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197961623887', 'num_games_owned': 1021, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1620587891}
review:
While I did enjoy the story and puzzles, i found the game a little shorter than I would have liked for what I paid for it, and ultimately the ending I chose wasn't a satisfactory conclusion I would have liked and having looked it up, I don't think the alternative one is much better. 

The game is a pretty standard point and click, though somewhat simplified over the normal context menu/scumm style approach to a more single click, things only have one interaction approach. It does have an interesting mechanic with the companion spot. which I though was pretty cool, it would have been nice to have explored that more as its not something that I have seen before.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960615148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1620436845}
review:
I loved The Whispered World 1 with all my heart and Silence is a worthy successor, beautifully written, voiced, with so much love for details.

I enjoyed every second of this experience.
Spot has to be the cutest little buddy ever to exist in a video game. Everything about this game is just charming and the visuals and music are stunning.

Thank you Daedalic for this masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333925835', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1620422643}
review: Oyun yorumlarda da ifade edildiği gibi gerçekten pek çok yerinde göz alıcı ve keyif veren bir görselliğe sahip. Kesintisiz bir akıcılığa ve sürükleyiciliğe ve harika bir senaryoya sahip olduğunu söyleyemeyiz fakat kurtaracak düzeyde. Pek çok yerde durağan gitmesinden ve takılıp ne yapacağınızı uzun uzun düşünüp aramaktan sıkılmak istemiyorsanız mutlaka full gameplay videosuyla birlikte yardım alarak oynayın. Kanaatimizce oyunun tarzından kaynaklanan bir sıkıntı var. Daha akıcı olması için etkileşim seçeneklerinin sayısının azaltılması ve interaktif film tarzında sunulması çok daha uygun olurdu. Ben Türkçe yamasıyla oynadım. Böyle olduğu halde yer yer takılıp sıkıldım. Yani keyif alabilmeniz için bu yama şart görünüyor. Anonymous aboneliği ile yamayı yükleyebilirsiniz. Peki verilen ücrete değer mi derseniz? 39+25 oyun+yama=64 lira böyle bir oyun için fiyat bir parça yüksek görünüyor aslında. Benim steam kredim vardı 25 lira, değerlendirmek için aldım. Bu tarz oyunlara özellikle meraklı iseniz değebilir ancak. Bunun dışında indirim vs. ile daha ucuza getirmeye çalışmanız tavsiye edilir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043753996', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1619862476}
review:
Es ist sehr schön gestaltet, die Stimmen sind super ausgewählt und es gibt auch einige neue Ideen für die Spielmechanik. Teilweise gibt es Dilemma, bei denen man Entscheidungen treffen muss.

Aber.

Ja, leider gibts ein Aber.

Ich habe mich die meiste Zeit enorm gelangweilt. Das Spiel hat eine Story von vielleicht 2 Stunden, die ich in 6 Stunden spielen musste. Die Musik wirkt leider nicht sehr anregend, sondern eher generisch. Und manche "Hürden" wirken etwas unnötig, gezwungen. Vielleicht doch mal, richtige Autoren/Drehbuchschreiber einsetzen oder wieder über den Humor kommen; das täuscht meistens über Langatmigkeit gut hinweg. 

Tut mir leid, Daedalic. Ich hätte es gerne gemocht.

author: {'steamid': '76561199138005283', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1618326306}
review:
玩到结局让我想到了玩剧本杀《古木吟》最后做选择的时候，所以说，虚幻的梦境它究竟有什么不好呢？
本作有中文语音，且可以调字幕，建议开中文语音也要调出字幕，个人觉得中文语音也听的不是很清晰且很像AI，缺乏感情，听不惯还是切了英文语音。
画面非常精致，音乐算是中规中矩吧，解谜有一些难度，操纵蠕虫这还时生平头一遭，爱了爱了，剧情看起来有些老套，不过萝莉是真的可爱呀。好像没有续作，结局太简单人物几乎都没有交代。

author: {'steamid': '76561198871729340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1617666528}
review: Ein Point & Click Adventure mit einfachen Rätseln und machbaren Puzzles, das vor allem durch seine wunderschöne Grafik und Musik besticht. Wunderschön gestaltete Szenen mit knuffigen Animationen und niedlichen Charakteren, nicht zu vergessen die reizenden kleinen fliegenden Krabben und einer noch knuffigeren allmächtigen Raupe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994796062', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1597599788}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 43.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283369534', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1514366762}

author: {'steamid': '76561198083559829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1617542543}
review: Certes, le jeu est court (je l'ai fini en trois jours sur des sessions de jeux d'environ 2-3h, sachant que je ne suis pas très habituée aux points and clicks), il est également assez simple (un avantage pour moi qui n'est pas forcément énormément de temps à passer dessus), mais il est surtout très joli, autant visuellement que narrativement. C'est une petite expérience très agréable que je recommanderais sans soucis.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966666227', 'num_games_owned': 982, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1616918519}
review: Great sequel to The Whispered World although the style is completely different. The puzzles are on the easier side, there is no real inventory which greatly reduces the amount of trial and error. The game is not very long but I enjoyed it a lot because of the beautiful graphics and the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004685493', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1616352907}
review:
Надзвичайно красивий і захоплюючий квест, але оригінал все ж був більш цілісним в плані подачі сюжету і там фінальна драма працювала краще. Моя вам порада - [u]навіть не думайте сідати за Silence, якщо ви не грали The Whispered World.[/u] Проблема сиквелу в тому, що гравець уже знайомий із цим світом і тому емоційний відклик буде значно слабший.

Ви можете заперечити: "але якщо я не грав The Whispered World, то все одно нічого не знатиму, а отже для мене все буде як в перший раз!" Та це не так. На початку гри вам все одно розкажуть суть першої частини і повірте, краще самому пережити цю бомбезну історію в оригіналі, ніж дізнатись з короткого діалогу в сиквелі.

Я зовсім не хочу, щоб у вас склалось погане враження про Silence. Наприклад, якщо говорити про геймплейну механіку, то її значно підтягнули, завдяки чому загадки стали більш інтуїтивними і зрозумілими. Та й взагалі, гра вийшла динамічнішою і живішою за медитативну і дуже складну першу частину. Знову ж таки, робота художників просто феноменальна! Але, як на мене, цінність проекту в його сюжеті, а він був кращий в оригіналі.

author: {'steamid': '76561199096563378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1629458872}

author: {'steamid': '76561198115820587', 'num_games_owned': 3074, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1516117616}
review:
Point'n click? Silence c'est la suite de The Whispered World, un des tout premier point'n click de chez Daedalic sorti en 2010. Un jeu que j'avais particulièrement apprécié à l'époque parce que assez poétique et mélancolique.

+ Très beau, les tableaux sont magnifiques, les personnages 3D bien implémentés dans les décors, les animations sont bonnes.
+ Musiques agréables, le thème est plutôt bon.
+ Interface plutôt bien pensée.
+ Un peu de poésie quand même, mais il faut être patient.
+ Énigmes (trop?) logiques
+ Système d'indices paramétrable, excellente idée.
+ Plein de succès à la con qui poussent à essayer un maximum d'interactions.
+ La fin
+ 5h à finir, ouf il était temps

- Aucune originalité, tout est prévisible et a été déjà fait mille fois.
- C'est niais.
- Narration pas toujours claire, certains passages s'enchainent sans explications.
- Très peu d'énigmes, toutes trop simples à mon avis.
- Pas de possibilité de skipper les cinématiques.
- Pas de sauvegarde manuelle, et les auto se font uniquement lors des temps de chargement. Ultra frustrant quand on quitte le jeu après une cinématique de 5mn et qu'on doit tout se retaper.
- Personnages têtes à claques.
- Des ** de QTE dans un point'n click?!
- Le cul entre 2 chaises, j'ai envie de dire que c'est un jeu prévu pour les petiots mais en même temps je n'y laisserai pas jouer mon gamin.

Pas terrible donc. Silence c'est un peu la merde enrobée dans un papier d'or. Vraiment splendide visuellement, mais très ennuyeux. À prendre comme un dessin-animé, ou comme un (joli) Telltale (ça reste cependant un bon cran au dessus d'un Telltale en terme de gameplay).

author: {'steamid': '76561197980176939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1615334581}
review: Disclaimer: I played for 0.2 hrs before deciding to judge this game. I'm sure the story is some sort of heart warming tale, but I can not deal with how slow paced and boring it is. I like slow paced games that can keep my attention, this is not one of them. I was already bored by the time the opening scene was half over. I got the the shadow puppets and noped out. The game has a clunky feel to it. Like it's a college project or something. The writing is kinds of crap too. "I didn't mean to scare you"? Yeah, you did and you were right to do so. It's a freakin war. She should be scared to leave the bunker. Clicking on an object puts you into a mini cut scene feeling thing of exposition about socks that is pretty annoying. The illusion of choice in the dialogue felt utterly pointless. The character didn't even say what I chose. Should have been left out of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076705047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1614290403}
review:
A brilliant, emotional, heart-wrenching story about a brother and sister doing their best to grow up in a war-torn country. It's about the unbridled creativity of a child's mind and the beauty and tragedy of escapism. 

The graphics are nicely stylized. there are barely any mechanics to speak of per se, but they are not needed either as the story is your main driving factor and the game is wise enough not to put anything else that can distract you from it. 

There's no need to say anything more about it. If you want a story that can test your resilience to tearing up, try this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011905987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1613779902}
review: Atmospheric adventure, a bit thin on plot and puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241192086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1613296417}
review:
Silence ist kein klassisches Adventure, d.h. eher wenige und einfache Rätsel, kein Inventar und kein fröhliches Kombinieren... das hat mich aber nicht gestört. Es kommt mehr wie ein Telltale-Game rüber, für mich ok. Insgesamt hat mir das Spiel wirklich gut gefallen. 

Atmosphäre:
Leider weniger Atmosphäre als in Teil 1. Teil 1 hat es geschafft mit jedem Kapitel eine eigene Stimmung bei mir zu erzeugen und eine entsprechende Atmosphäre aufzubauen. Hier ist die Atmosphäre nahezu gleich über das gesamte Spiel. Dennoch schöne Musik, gute graphische Darstellung. Die besten Screens und immersivsten Momente kommen hier allerdings in den letzten 30 min des Games, genau davon hätte ich mehr gewollt. 

Story:
Schöne Story, aber leider sehr vorhersehbare Handlung, kein Spannungsaufbau. Es hat eine komplette deutsche Synchro, was das Erleben der Story sehr angenehm macht. 

Charaktere:
Flache Charaktere, die bekommen überhaupt keine Geschichte. Nur Renie gefällt mir in dem Kontext. Selbst Noah/Sadwick kommt für mich zu flach rüber. 
Insgesamt mochte ich Renie sehr und Spot ist auch süß. Shana ist super dargestellt, auch wenn ihr Auftritt kurz ist. 
Aber: Das ist nicht Sadwick - so gar nicht! Seine Charakterdarstellung ging für mich gar nicht. 

Spielzeit und Technisches:
Mit knapp 6 Stunden recht kurz und es bleibt auch so viel offen, wo noch Potenzial gewesen wäre. 
Es gibt keine eigene Speichermöglichkeit, nur Auto-Save - echt mies. 
Diese langen Ladescreens nerven so hart. Sie dauern sooooo lang. Immer wieder. Und wieder. Ahhhhhhh!!!
Mies auch, dass das verbuggte Achievement 'Guter Zuhörer' bis heute nicht gefixt wurde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048250545', 'num_games_owned': 963, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1613187826}
review:
Gostei muito mais desse jogo do que o antecessor (The Whispered World). Alguns reclamam que a história é curta, eu achei na medida certa. O jogo traz uma imersão muito bacana.

I liked this game much more than its predecessor (The Whispered World). Some complain that the story is short, I thought it was just right. The game brings a very nice immersion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034348551', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1613343993}
review:
Pros:
-Gorgeous game. It's really, really beautiful, the designers clearly poured their heart into the art. If you are into lovely art, this game might be worth playing for the aesthetics alone.
-Pleasant music. Artistically speaking, this is a very good game.

Cons:
-Unskippable cutscenes. Seriously, how the hell does any modern game come with unskippable cutscenes? Slow and long to boot. It's extra irritating because there are no manual saves, and the game saves automatically before the cutscenes, so you are forced to rewatch them every time you come back to play.
-No manual saves. You want to grab that achievement you missed in the middle of the game, or replay a cute part? Too bad. Gotta start over from scratch. And again, you can't skip cutscenes, so it's a long way to go. 
-Extremely flat voice acting, especially for the little girl. The only character who has actual personality and emotion in their delivery is the warrior girl. Unfortunately, said personality and emotion boil down to treating everybody around her like crap.
-A tiny cast of shallow and/or unlikeable characters. Even if you start warming up to any of them (I ended up kinda liking the bulky guy), it ultimately doesn't matter because you are explicitly told from the beginning that they are not real and that going home will erase them. This isn't presented as a moral dilemma either (like "is it right to go home if it means erasing Silence?"), the only hesitation comes from the bond between the siblings, the rest of the cast is always treated as casually expendable.
-Little to no freedom to explore or experiment. You don't even have an inventory.
-Dialogues are neither funny nor interesting, and in some cases they are actively painful (like in the rock song).
-Very unsatisfying endings.

review:
Me ha parecido una historia realmente buena. La pena que como siempre con Daedalic hay algunos bugs y al principio del juego tuve que borrar todo y volver a empezar porque con las partidas guardadas, no se arreglaba.

Visualmente es maravilloso; muy bien desarrollados los personajes, entornos y música.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040022868', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1612634286}

author: {'steamid': '76561198369141734', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1612316169}
review:
Je viens de finir le jeu et il est vraiment génial !
Le jeu est vraiment beau , moi qui ne joue pas aux jeux "point'n click" habituellement , là j'ai adoré.
Les seuls points faibles à mon goût c'est que les personnages secondaires sont pas assez exploités et les énigmes sont plutôt simple mais cela ne retire en rien le charme du jeu.
Un jeu rempli de poésie que je conseille à tous !

author: {'steamid': '76561198033217430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1611174667}
review:
Das Spiel erzählt sehr stimmungsvoll eine schöne Geschichte. Es ist etwas zwischen Adventure und interaktiver Film. Mir hat es sehr gefallen, dass es „einfache“ Rätzel waren und ich nicht wie bei vielen Adventures alle Gegenstände in einem Inventar auf gut Glück versuchen muss zu kombinieren.
Fazit: sehr empfehlenswert

author: {'steamid': '76561198345553779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1610816975}
review:
[h1]Solides, kindgerechtes Click-Adventure[/h1] 

Silence is eigentlich der Nachfolger von "The Whispered World", aber so wie ich sollten auch andere Speiler kein Problem haben, der Story zu folgen, denn alles Wichtige über den ersten Besuch des Waisenjungen Noah in dieser Fantasiewelt "Silence" erfährt man am Anfang bzw. durch Gespräche im Spiel. Die Spielzeit beträgt um die 7h, wer auf Achievements aus ist, sollte mindestens zwei Durchläufe einplanen. Ich persönlich fand, die Geschichte hätte etwas länger sein können, zumal ein nicht unerheblicher Teil des Spiels aus Filmsequenzen besteht, wo man gar nichts zu tun hat. Die Anzahl der Rätsel ist also überschaubar.

"Silence" ist einfach zu bedienen, eine Maus reicht vollkommen aus. Trotz dieser spartanischen Bedienung hat man nicht das Gefühl, das ewas fehlt, auch, weil man auf ein exzessives, zu durchwühlendes Inventar (Rucksack o.ä.) analog zu anderen Spielen verzichtet hat. Passend dazu sind auch die Aufgaben in "Silence" einfach bis mittelschwer, und die Hilfe (mittlere Maustaste oder Leertaste) blendet verfügbare Aktionspunkte auf dem Bildschirm und/oder einen Hinweis ein (konfigurierbar).

Da das Spiel nicht gewaltfrei ist – Messer und Bomben kommen nicht nur in der Kriegswelt der Rahmenhandlung vor – ist es für kleine Kinder trotzdem ungeeignet.

An vielen Stellen im Spiel hat der Spieler die Möglichkeit, eine Entscheidung zu treffen. Oftmals ist es für den Fortgang der Geschichte völlig egal, welche Option mal wählt, manchmal (recht offensichtlich, wann) ist es aber eine Entscheidung zwischen Leben und Tod. Ja, man kann in diesem Spiel gelegentlich sterben, aber selbst dann wird man nach kurzer Wartezeit auf den letzten Speicherpunkt zurückgesetzt,

Ach ja, Stichpunkt Wartezeit: Das Warten mit schwarzem Bildschirm beim Szenenwechsel nervt. Neist dauert es 10s, selbst wenn man den gleichen Raum bzw. die gleiche Szene gerade zuvor erst betreten hatte. Und ich habe eine schnelle SSD! Ansonsten gibt die Performance keinen Grund zur Klage, selbst mit einer etwas schwächeren GeForce 1050 Ti im Notebook habe ich 60fps (mit Panel synchronisiert).

Die Grafik selbst ist gefällig und zum Spiel passend in einer Art Malstil gehalten, also nicht fotorealistisch. (Aber deutlich ansprechender die vom Vorgänger!) Die Szenen wirken durch leichte Bewegungen der Wolken, Staubpartikel, Dunstwolken oder auch der gerade inaktiven Personen sehr lebendig und sind auch sonst eine Augenweide. Etwas schade ist, dass nur 16:9-Modi zur Verfügung stehen, auf meinem 16:10-Bildschirm habe ich schwarze Balken unten und oben. Immerhin bleibt das Seitenverhältnis konstant, da stört das nicht.
Auch die Musik ist nicht schlecht, wenngleich nicht gerade mit Ohrwurmhits.

Bugs oder Probleme hatte ich bisher keine.
Die Achievements sind ziemlich viele, darunter etliche, die man beim Durchspielen sicher bekommt, einige recht dumme (Lasse den Furzpilz 10 furzen – eher was für dressierte Affen) und einige anspruchsvolle, die den Begriff Errungenschaften wirklich verdient haben.

Für  Kinder ab ca. 12 Jahren und erwachsene Fantasy-Fans mit kindlichem Gemüt gut geeignet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092122082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1608936514}
review: Silence ist kein normales Adventure: Es hat kein Inventar für Gegenstände, die man versuchen kann an verschiedenen Dingen zu benutzen. Das Spiel ist mehr in verschiedene Rätsel aufgeteilt, die man nach und nach in den entsprechenden Gebieten löst. Nichtsdestotrotz machen die Rätsel Spaß und auch die Story hat mir gut gefallen. Einzig das Spiel war recht kurz. Für zwischendurch ein schönes Erlebnis.

author: {'steamid': '76561199122046703', 'num_games_owned': 8, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1608933016}
review:
W grze Silence wcielamy się w Noah i jego młodszą siostrę Renie oraz zmiennokształtną dżdżownicę Spot.

Aktualnie trwa wojna, a podczas bombardowania rodzeństwo chowa się do schronu. Pech chciał że bomba spadła wprost na nich, przez co zostają przeniesieni do tajemniczej krainy i tam rozdzieleni.
Owa kraina także znajduje się w stanie wojny, pomiędzy rebeliantami, a fałszywą królową. Zadaniem bohaterów jest odnalezienie siebie nawzajem i przyłączenie się do rebelii.

Kraina Silence prezentuje się bardzo bogato, design lokacji potrafi zachwycić. Znajdziemy tam wymyślone zwierzęta, przerażające potwory i inne kreatury które nasze oczy nie widziały.
Możemy natrafić także na trudne wybory moralne, które podjęcia ich nie jest wcale takie łatwe.

# Plusy:
- Fabuła
- Postacie
- Grafika
- Przyjemny dla ucha soundtrack
- System wyborów moralnych

# Minusy:
- Częste i długie ekrany wczytywania

review:
I had a nice time playing this game! Point and click games tend to be difficult with near impossible action to deduct using 76 points in a precise order that doesn't seem logic...Here it makes sense, you know how to move forward, you know what to do, when, where...
The story is kind of weird, and it looks like there was another game before that or maybe it's just part of the story, but still I loved the atmosphere, design, concept...
The music is not major but it's adapted to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101703128', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1606855505}
review:
A Silence bejelentésének anno nagyon örültem, aztán az első kritikák elrettentettek, ugyanis rövid és könnyű játéknak írták le a játékot, vagyis pont a Whispered World ellentéteként. És sajnos ennek igazat kell adjak, bár engem csak a rövidség bánt.

Mert a játékmenet változása önmagában nem egy rossz dolog. Lehet, hogy nem éget agysejteket, de sokszor ötletes, megint vannak Pötyi-szegmensek, összességében intenzív élményt ad a játék, amíg játszol. Csak kár, hogy 5 és fél óra(!) alatt kipörgettem. Bár a trófeavadászok még elszórakozhatnának egy darabig vele, engem az ilyesmi nem motivál. Ellenben megszólíthat egy fiatalabb közönséget is, akiknek mondjuk az eredeti Whispered World komoly fejfájásokat okozna.

Ami nagyon tetszett, hogy ezúttal két karaktert irányítunk felváltva, és nagyon átjön, hogy a két különböző jellem mennyire másképp reagál a világra. De dicsérnem kell a grafikát is, olyan, mintha szép festmények előtt mozognának a szereplők, és maguk is művészi hatást keltenek. Képeken tartottam a 3D-s Pöttytől, de azt kell mondjam, játék közben irtó cuki! A zene most is elsőrangú, és ezúttal az angol szinkron is jól sikerült.

A játék valahol az előfutára lehetett a 2017-es Katedrálisnak, hisz tárgylista már itt sincs - tehát tárgyakat kombinálni nem fogunk, max egymáson használni -, ellenben vannak ügyességi részek, és belengeti a játék, hogy a döntéseid befolyásolják a történetet. De igazából meg nem. Félreértés ne essék, nem ígért ilyet a játék, csak a párbeszédrendszer felépítési végig ilyen érzetet kelt. Ugyanis az NPC-k szövegeire kétféleképpen reagálhatsz, és így megy tovább a párbeszéd, cselekmény. És igen, vannak nüansznyi eltérések (más jelenetecskét látunk), de a játék lineárisan halad előre. Nagyobb baj, hogy kevés a szereplő - akik így sem tudnak kibontakozni -, és hogy a történetben nem egyszer azt érzed, mintha valami hiányozna. Érdekes, mert a szintén 2016-os Deponia Doomsday ilyen szempontból (is) rendben van.

Amiért mégis kellemes emlék marad, hogy egy csomó érzelmet kiváltott belőlem, meg amíg tart, tényleg csodás élmény. Annak azért jobban örültem volna, ha a történet tartalmasabb.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053532460', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1606535150}
review:
Precursor for this review, I did NOT play the whispered world, I understand that this is a sequel so I am likely missing some or a lot of context for the rest of the game.

Silence is a nice cut short game but unfortunately falls short with dialogue options that wind up having the character saying something completely different usually something quite nice like "ask about the big bang theory" then comes out "eat shit and fuck the big bang theory" this made the characters feel really estranged to me, Also not helped by the story being really predictable but not very engaging. made me not care for them as much which since the ending SPOILERS: has a heavy emphasis on death and letting go of those people, but since I feel disconnected from the characters that are dying I can't bring myself to feel anything for them. The ending felt authentic but unfortunately everything beforehand kind of betrays it.

Concluding, great potential, would love to see what the team could do with a better story, not to say this story is the bad, but not very good either just fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022507664', 'num_games_owned': 1576, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1606705956}
review:

잦은 로딩 화면과 영혼없는 성우의 목소리(리나), 한박자 늦는 느린 반응들..
이런 부분 때문에 몰입감이 깨지는 경우가 많았던 것 같아 아쉬움

author: {'steamid': '76561197971569035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 362, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1606667631}
review: Punto importante di questo gioco: è il seguito di "the whispered world" e nei primi 5 minuti di gioco vi spoilera tutta la trama del gioco precedente. Per quanto non è fondamentale nei termini della storia se intendete giocarlo giocate prima quello. È difficile trovare punti negativi nei giochi della Daedalic, sono sempre ottime storie narrate in maniera egregia ma solitamente molto corte e con rari colpi di scena. Questo gioco entra in quella categoria, è interessante ma estremamente corto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077153956', 'num_games_owned': 4302, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1606578979}
review: Daedalic настоящие мастера в придумывании оригинальных миров, но с главными героями и продолжениями историй у них складывается не очень. Хотя начинается Silence очень круто - брат Ноа и сестра Рени скрываются в убежище и делают не самый простой выбор в заставке, после чего оказываются заваленные обломками. По понятной причине финальный твист The Whispered World в продолжении было провернуть нельзя, мы прекрасно понимали где и почему мы находимся, поэтому на арену сразу вывели Искателей и главного антагониста Королеву Лжи. Действие происходит в безумно красивых локациях, под оркестровый сануд, да ещё и головоломки помогает снова решать офигенный Капль. Но тут плюсы Silence заканчиваются. Приключения Рени получились короткими, скомканными и пресными; история совсем не цепляет, второстепенные персонажи пусты и надуманны,когда в финале появляется выбор кого спасать их или гусеницу я даже не раздумывал. Присутствие пердёжных шуток и употребление наркотиков детьми, на мой взгляд перебор в такой трагичной истории, но за это критиковать не буду. В итоге поставлю 7.0 за красивую обёртку, но дальше доить эту серию не стоит. Рекомендую любителям красивых казуальных квестов, не более.

author: {'steamid': '76561198947859118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1604766024}
review: Jeu vriamnet pas maniable sur ordinateur . Beaucoup trop court . Enigmes vraiment trop faciles . Dommage car le monde est beau et interessant mais leur exercices d'équilibre sans arrêt sont sans interêt !

author: {'steamid': '76561199079212713', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1604579121}
review: 挺好的游戏，剧情比较完善，角色性格也丰富，画面很精美并且部分场景惊艳，比较接近于一个完善的成品；设定上关于故事和梦境的联系是比较出彩的地方；英配更好些，但是情感张力仍然不够，解密比较简单，很少卡壳，更像是一部可参与的电影；运行起来存储和场景切换花费时间较长，电脑风扇也是高速运行

author: {'steamid': '76561198101314886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1411, 'last_played': 1635565633}
review: Really wish there were more games like this one. I hope the developers continue to make games as beautiful and interesting as this one, as well as other series like Deponia. As someone who loves playing point and click games, this one is easily one of the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010077003', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1604164019}
review:
3/5
Probabilmente questo gioco ha deluso o sorpreso molti di quella che l'hanno giocato conoscendo il predecessore. Se da un lato è infinitamente più appagante dal punto di vista grafico, dall'altro non è la classica avventura grafica Daedalic, ma un ibrido tra un'avventura grafica e un'avventura dinamica con tanto di movimenti del mouse per spostare oggetti o stare in equilibrio. Gli enigmi sono infatti molto facili, non essendoci praticamente un inventario e decine di oggetti da combinare, bensì solo 4 o 5 interazioni per schermata che comunque non sono mai più di due o tre. Del resto come scritto sembra quasi un film di animazione di Hollywood, la storia regge bene pur ricalcando quella del precedente e nonostante i personaggi ne siano anche a conoscenza. Probabilmente quindi se fosse stata un'avventura grafica più in stile della precedente sarebbe stato un'ottimo titolo, invece, sebbene apprezzi il coraggio, non mi ha entusiasmato la sfida degli enigmi.
Nel complesso consigliato comunque per l'originalità, ma solo in sconto e secondo me è necessario conoscere il predecessore per apprezzarlo in pieno.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996355644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1610224971}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035734731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1479482640}
review: This game is beautiful and has some good ideas but the gameplay is so easy that it's virtually non-existent and the game is so short that it's over before you even started. If you want to play a game only for the experience this is a game for you, but if you loved the first Whispered World for the world building and interesting puzzles you should just leave this one alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561199057036681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 989, 'last_played': 1602363638}
review:
Игра выглядит как небольшое дополнение к оригиналу (The Whispered world) или даже спинофф, нежели самостоятельная часть. Суть ее осталась та же, с небольшой разницей в конце приключения. Визуально красивая и приятная, с замечательной музыкой. По новым персонажам пробегаются вскользь, какого-то особого отклика они не вызывают (разве что, повстанческая мадам немного бесит). Но наверное по лору игры можно списать это на [spoiler]воображение ребенка[/spoiler]. Юмор иногда специфический (про всякие грибы/пыльцу, забавно, но немного неуютно). Самые раздражающие существа - луми, которые выдаются за, якобы, милых и смешных (а я вот терпеть подобных не могу). Искатели - это вообще что-то из "Унесенных призраками" Миядзаки. А вот Капль - просто верх милашества)
Управлять удобно, сложность загадок минимальная, даже инвентаря нет, так что игра проходится как обычное приключение с парочкой экшен-элементов. Я бы даже назвала ее трехмерным мультфильмом. В частности из-за катсцен/диалогов, которые субъективно отнимают много времени и, к большому моему сожалению, не проматываются.

Плохие впечатления касаются технической части. Игру пришлось проходить 4 раза и это не считая двух раз потраченных на демо-версию (перед покупкой знакомилась с игрой и разными вариантами ответов).
В 1-й раз игра забаговалась графически после загрузки с контрольной точки и играть в нее дальше было невозможно. Поэтому во 2-ом прохождении я никогда не грузилась с контрольных точек из самой игры, на всякий случай. Хотя в последующих прохождениях проблем с загрузкой не было. 
В процессе игры многие контрольные точки сохраняются долго на фоне черного экрана. Может дело в моем жестком диске (хотя 7200 оборотов не так уж мало). Но тем не менее, черные экраны поднадоели. Сама эта система сохранений не понравилась, т.к. когда приходилось загружаться, она, в зависимости от положения в сцене, могла запустить всё вместе с катсценами, которые, повторюсь, нельзя промотать. Никакими пробелами или ЛКМ, ничем. Для человека, которому пришлось играть 4 раза, это было пыткой. Пропуск реплик и вне катсцен работает не всегда. Особенно это забавно в свете того, что есть достижение, которое дают за то что не пропускаешь реплики. К слову, и оно и еще одно - тоже забагованные и работают не у всех.
Вердикт: если не гонитесь за достижениями, то пройдете легко и без напряга. Жаждущим ачивок надо быть внимательными и осторожными)

author: {'steamid': '76561198120670122', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1602534393}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049316790', 'num_games_owned': 2256, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1601986762}
review:
[i]Красочная приключенческая игра о мире грёз и реальности[/i]

Silence – это своеобразный Whispered World 2.0, продолжение и в то же время переосмысление [url= https://store.steampowered.com/app/268540/]одноименного квеста[/url] от Daedalic.

C точки зрения игровых механик, вторая часть достаточно далеко ушла от канонов жанра Point & Click: перед нами скорее [b]интерактивное кино с красочной картинкой[/b], трёхмерными моделями и соответствующей постановкой камеры в диалогах. [b]Исчез инвентарь, а в каждой сцене мы ограничены всего парой-тройкой экранов[/b]. Взяв в руки какой-то предмет нам почти сразу предлагает найти ему применение, а не бегать с полными карманами хлама по разным локациям. При таком подходе загадке стали заметно проще, так что [b]авторы решили добавить в проект ряд экшен элементов[/b]: перемешать объекты в нужную сторону, держать баланс и т.п. Смотрится достаточно органично, хотя по вкусу придётся далеко не каждому.

Впрочем, главная составляющая игры – история – от всех этих изменений отнюдь не пострадала. Безмолвный мир вышел куда богаче как на интересных персонажей, к которым ты проникаешься симпатией, так и на красочные локации, что лишь подчёркивается великолепно подобранной музыкой. Сюжет не успевает наскучить: загадки бодро сменяются катсценами, мы не засиживаемся на одном месте, [b]с интересом наблюдая за невероятным приключением[/b]. Пусть местами оно наивное, грустное, короткое или даже предсказуемое, но оттого не менее увлекательное.

[i]P.S. Чтобы исправить проблемы долгих загрузок попробуйте отключить Вертикальную синхронизацию в настройках.[/i]

[b]Итого: 7,5/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198033282639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1601196574}
review: It is a cute point and click puzzle game with a decent story line. You get to choose some different outcomes and the game play time is okay but you can get through it pretty fast and the puzzles arn't to hard. The graphics and story line are pretty good though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302970410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1600875595}
review:
Silence est un jeu adorable, magnifiquement réalisé et bien coloré malgré les thèmes sombres abordés. Les personnages y sont attachants, et Spot est un élément relativement original pour résoudre des énigmes (puisqu'il peut adopter trois formes de base et en "débloquer" certaines à certains passages de jeu). 

Cependant, qualifier ce jeu de point'n'click à proprement parler serait mensonger, il ressemble plus à une sorte de livre interactif qu'à un véritable jeu d'aventure. Les énigmes sont simples, et se résolvent facilement. 
Les choix de dialogue n'influent malheureusement pas du tout sur le scénario, seule une fin alternative vous sera proposée à la toute dernière scène du jeu, selon ce que vous décidez de faire. 

En point négatif, ce jeu est court, trop court. A peine 3h en prenant biiiien mon temps pour tout explorer, et pour résoudre les énigmes. Cependant, n'aurait-il pas été trop répétitif s'il avait plus long ? 

En bref, un titre qui m'a fait voyager et que j'ai adoré.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990090707', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1600445775}
review:
Finished Silence.

Silence is an adventure and the successor of The Whispered World. After an airstrike, you wake up in the land of Silence. In this, a false queen claimed reign who sent her Seekers to search for the splinter of the mirror in the throne room. This splinter is said to have magical powers. The false queen needs this splinter to claim her final power. You play Noah/Sedwick and Renie, his sister, to find your way in Silence. You join the rebellion against the false queen, find the splinter and try to get back into your own world.

Silence is a decent adventure, though the "adventure"-parts are very, very reduced: there is basically zero inventory, resulting in very limited interaction options. The main process is simply to click on the hot spots and see the story evolving. As such, the demands of the game are very, very low. It plays rather more like an interactive movie.

The story continues the theme of The Whispered World meaning: it beautiful, melancholic, sad and adorable at the very same time. Though the game is over in a couple of hours. The game does not bear any real challenges and thus lacks to deliver any feeling of success or mastery on some "riddles".

Pros:
* Nice story (with a bitter ending though).
* Gorgeous graphics.
* Cute Renie.

Cons:
* Only one save game.
* Very short gameplay.
* Underwhelming riddles.

7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561199067528726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1600325603}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969961000', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1597581252}
review:
[h1] Silence: The Whispered World 2 Review [/h1]

I've played the first game a long time ago, it was nice though I'll admit, didn't remember much of it until I started playing this one.

Now, [b]Silence[/b] is beautiful point & click adventure game with nicely drawn characters, good voice acting and a lovely story.

It also got a very simplistic view on gameplay, there is no real inventory and everything is basically done with a click on either the right, left or middle (scroll) buttons of the mouse.

Unlike most point & clicks though, there are sequences in [b]Silence[/b] where your characters can die, there are also very few choices with actual consequences but the few that are there are pretty big decisions.

I'll also want to point out that I really loved the character of [b]Spot[/b], absulutely adorable.

That said, the lack of regular save options and the reliance on checkpoint is a sore spot for me because it means that in order to complete all game achievements you actually need to re-play the game from the start at least 2 more times, a regular save system with save slots, even a limited one whould have allowed for achievement hunting more efficiently and more comfortably, without having to replay through unnecessary parts of the game.

The ingame hint system is also nice but it's also way too easy to use to a point that some may get used to relying on it, I found myself using it even when I didn't need it just because it was a click away and was one with the option to show hotspots, separate buttons for hotspots and hints whould have been better in my opinion.

Overall, I really enjoyed playing [b]Silence: The Whispered World 2[/b] and I think it's a real gem that I'd recommend to any adventure gamer out there.

[b][u]PROS:[/u][/b]

[list]
    [*]Good Visuals
    [*]Excellent voice acting
    [*]Simple gameplay
    [*]Good story
    [*]Good, balanced difficulity level
    [*]Hint System
[/list]

[b][u]CONS:[/u][/b]

[list]
    [*]Save system based on checkpoint, no manual saves
    [*]You can die sometimes
    [*]Hint System
[/list]

[b]Overall Score:[/b] 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198317289543', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1579738352}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014698888', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1596922633}
review:
This is the first point & click adventure game I've enjoyed enough to finish in a long time.  This game features a captivating story and some great animations to accompany it.  The point & click puzzles are very light and serve more as a means to keep you engaged as the story is told rather than the primary mechanic to keep you engaged.  I personally really enjoyed that I didn't have to spend hours clicking on every item in a scene to hear some trite dialog and instead was able to keep the story moving rather quickly.  Many point & click fans may find this to be a detriment, though, as there really aren't any meaningful or difficult puzzles.

Big aspect I did not appreciate is an unnecessary use of profanity throughout the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142639955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1596465157}
review:
这不是款好游戏。
首先载入就极慢，已经让玩家有些不爽，并且第一个场景开始操作就极其不舒服却没有展现这个游戏最强的美工。可以说开局劝退。
本着坚持下去的心态继续前进，操作的不适感越来越强，玩家的引导做得极为糟糕，解密的谜底也非常无迹可寻。有些流程甚至只是毫无创意的来回走动浪费时间，而这被浪费的时间是强制的，你无法跑动也无法跳过剧情，甚至连寻路都非常蠢。
我不知道这游戏的剧情好不好，因为我根本玩不下去接触不到更多剧情。如果一个产品在展现自己的优点之前就用自己的缺点把用户劝退，毫无疑问这是个失败的产品。

author: {'steamid': '76561197995596423', 'num_games_owned': 1765, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1595864933}
review:
[i]Silence[/i], like [i]The Whispered World[/i] before it, is a compensatory fairy-tale and, like all compensatory fairy-tales, has a strong undertone of tragedy beneath its colourful, happy-go-lucky fantasy. A powerful and well played metaphor for the tragedy underlining the gleeful world of Silence is Sadwick, “the tragic clown”, “the clown that never laughed”, [i]The Whispered World[/i]’s depressive protagonist and also a central character in [i]Silence[/i]. But, unlike in the first game, which had to carefully and subtly build up for the big reveal at the end, here the story’s compensatory nature is made explicit from the very beginning and the fact that you know it and the game doesn’t have to restrain itself in order to conceal it makes it ten times better and allows for some moments of unbridled creativity and adventure game design brilliance that aren’t usually possible when the developers constrain themselves, confining their creativity within the boundaries of building a “proper” story. Although it has its share of plot twists and big reveals, the story in [i]Silence[/i] is only sketched in thin lines and the developers’ imagination runs freely, creating many memorable moments of pure adventure happiness. Like, for example, the episode with the psychedelic flowers or when Rennie dives among the clouds with moth Spot at her side, which is so gratuitous and surreal, so out of context and unrelated to the already darkening plot that you immediately sense it for what it is: the last moment of serene, overplayed happiness, before the unavoidable tragedy sets in. A moment of pure joy, when you know tragedy is closer than ever, you feel it lurking in the background, you’re aware that the game is softening a terrible blow which you are already beginning to feel in your stomach, but you’re happy all the same. You’re flying with Spot through the clouds and you’re unreservedly happy in that fleeting moment, you wish for it to last a little bit longer and you’re grateful that the game offered it to you before dragging you through the bitter ending.
 
I loved [i]Silence[/i] for many reasons, but I especially loved it for that moment which is one of the finest adventure games can craft and offer these days.

review: 断断续续玩了差不多7个小时，两个结局都通关了，怎么说呢前期有些无聊，场景转换读条比较慢，这一点有点影响到游戏体验，但是游戏的画面真的很精致，游戏叙事也比较完整，小女孩和斑斑都很可爱，变形的元素增加了游戏的可玩性，游戏的结尾部分真的震撼到我了，尤其是小女孩和斑斑一起在云里面畅游的那一段给我带来了很深的印象，场景非常精致，每一帧都可以单独截下来做壁纸，结尾的反转也很好，感动并且引人深思，建议喜欢剧情和解密的玩家入手，坚持玩到结尾，它会给你一个惊喜的！

author: {'steamid': '76561198165722536', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1593376730}
review:
I would like to love this game, as I love Daedalic games, and it has some good moments in it. However, there are certain aspect that really disappointed me.

Pros.
- technically well made (graphics, music, animations, sounds, etc)
- joypad support
- Renie and Spot are so cute

Cons.
- oversimplified puzzles
- game is too short

What triggered me: (Spoilers ahead)
- the game is a direct sequel to "The whispered world" (which was... well, not so accessible, but in the end it delivered a good plot). However, instead of building upon a new idea, this game spends its short time by making the characters remind you how good the prequel was.
- the ending is identical to the prequel, and the characters have been telling you about this since the beginning of the game.

in the end this feels more like a reboot than a full new game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025716472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1593427619}
review:
The problems are simple 
- There's only about 3 actual puzzles in the whole game. The rest is a matter of click here, click there, with very little actual deduction required. This is exacerbated by the lack of inventory screen; instead the uber-modern context-sensitive controls will automatically prompt the use of each item on whatever thing you need to use it on, just to provide maximum assurance that you won't have to think for yourself at any point.
- One of the main characters is a little girl who you're clearly meant to think is sooo cute and find the sight of her getting upset to be so emotionally distressing that it provides you all the motivation you need to save the day. Unfortunately, she does not have this effect due to her voice actor, who is probably an actual child so I don't want to be too harsh, but she barely seems to understand the words that she's saying, resulting in most of her lines being read in a flat, emotionless manner that just makes her kinda annoying.
- The ending is pretty much just a retread of the ending to The Whispered World. There's actually two endings to choose from, but you don't really learn anything new. You're clearly meant to see both in order to get the full picture, but to me that somewhat lessens the impact of them both. One of them could be interpreted as a sequel hook, but sadly I'm not sure I care enough anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052510862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1592590292}
review:
The Whispered World è stata una ag classica che più classica non si più. SIlence, che ne è il seguito in qualche modo, è un gioco di totale rottura anche da quelli che erano gli standard di Daedalic di allora. Fu un esperimento, secondo me in parte riuscito, di cercare di inserire dinamicità visiva e regia alle classiche avventure punta e clicca. Dove il cliccare non doveva essere necessariamente riferito al semplice raccogli l'oggetto ma anche ad azioni contestuali o di "movimento". Era un po lo stile delle prime avventure di Telltale, che avevano azzeccato la formula rimanendo fedeli ad un discorso di gameplay ma con un movimento generale della parte visiva che dava dinamicità al tutto, rendendo le opere molto più televisive. 
Silence nel particolare è anche bello da vedere se si considerano gli anni e i limiti produttivi di Daedealic. Bello nel senso che le atmosfere, le scene, i set, sono ben concepiti e molto fiabeschi. La parte finale è molto dinamica visivamente e mi è piaciuta tantissimo. Secondo me questo era un modello da ripercorrere. Forse rende le ag più semplici è vero, ma di certo le rende meno anacronistiche. 
Atmosfera, magia, sentimenti ed emozioni in un'esperienza anche angosciante e tetra. Bello. Ovviamente non privdi difetti ma bello.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096980945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1592063450}
review:
Incredibly beautiful and incredibly sad! Also tons of cute and funny moments! The visuals are amazing, outstanding cutscenes and most adorable characters; you're going to meet the cutest caterpillar-puppy in the whole world! The gameplay is easy enough, just try-and-error, so the game feels more like an interactive movie. That said, it's ten times better (both visually and story-wise) than your average Hollywood movie.
This is the sequence to the Whispered World, you kind of need to play that in advance to understand the whole story. The Whispered World was also cute 'though not quite as stunning and I felt a little depressed playing it, because the main character is always sad. Playing Silence I had tears in my eyes at the beginning and in the end... But I would definitely recommend it anyway, it's absolutely gorgeous and in between it was funny and witty...

author: {'steamid': '76561198237673034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1362, 'last_played': 1590920895}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002134811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1590550748}
review: Silence is quite a beautiful game, with a solid story and good characters. I realized fairly soon after starting that this is actually a sequel to The Whispered World, due to all the references to past events, but even without playing that game the story here can stand on its own. It does still kind of assume you've played the first game, with some characters being introduced for the first time like they're old buddies of yours, which can be a bit weird. Regardless, what we have here is a nice narrative adventure that doesn't take very long to finish at all. Puzzles are mostly very easy, as I think the modern attention span no longer supports trying to decode some obscure logic and making no headway for hours. This lets the focus settle mainly on the story, characters, and visuals. For all the establishing of characters though, the game pretty much ends right as you're getting more invested. A lot of production value went into making this game, so I understand why it's limited in scope, but it's still a bit disappointing that it wasn't a little longer. Still, if you're looking for a pleasing and bite-sized adventure game to spend a few hours on, this would be worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322955428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1590800307}
review: Первая часть Безмолвного мира была более мозгодробильной. Эта больше рассчитана на детей: задачки не сложные, проходится без особых проблем. Концовки уже не смогут вас так удивить, как в первой части, скорее немного опечалят. В целом хороший квест, рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325363687', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1483102030}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020875095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1650891658}
review:
While not really a classic point and click adventure game, I did enjoy it, especially since I had just finished its older and much more complicated brother, "The Whispered World", so all the characters were fresh in my mind. 
The graphics are really pretty but unfortunately the game is quite short and it doesn't have many different areas to explore. It has 2 different endings, similar to the first game. 
In terms of gameplay, you don't have any inventory, so the gameplay consists in mostly clicking stuff and hoping you click on the right thing. Do I recommend it? Yes. But keep in mind I do like walking simulators and all that, so I don't mind a game that's light (read that doesn't really have any) on puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137664255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1590664954}
review:
BGM和场景刻画满分，人物设计很出色，总体玩下来就像是看了一场十分出色的童话电影。强烈建议英文配音玩，中文配音实属拉胯这个游戏。

最重要的是，这个游戏感动到我了。
                                                  
游戏评分：8.6分（小女孩逃避与面对的抉择）
